elements.description:
Unlike most other drawing elements that can use chartData directly, area requires that data first be passed through d3.stack: https://github.com/d3/d3-shape/blob/master/README.md#stack

### Usage

    <px-vis-svg
      width="[[width]]"
      height="[[height]]"
      margin="[[margin]]"
      svg="{{svg}}">
    </px-vis-svg>
    <px-vis-scale
      x-axis-type="time"
      y-axis-type="linear"
      complete-series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
      data-extents="[[dataExtents]]"
      width="[[width]]"
      height="[[height]]"
      margin="[[margin]]"
      chart-data={{chartData}}
      x="{{x}}"
      y="{{y}}"
      selected-domain="[[selectedDomain]]">
    </px-vis-scale>

    <px-vis-area-svg
      svg="[[svg]]"
      complete-series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
      chart-data="[[stackedChartData]]"
      x="[[x]]"
      y="[[y]]"
      domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]">
    </px-vis-area-svg>

properties.name: svg
properties.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

properties.name: _uniqueIdsUsed
properties.description:
Array of unique IDs generated for this comp. cleaned from global
store on detached

properties.name: pxSvgElem
properties.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

properties.name: x
properties.description:
x is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

properties.name: y
properties.description:
y is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

properties.name: chartData
properties.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

properties.name: clipPath
properties.description: Holder for a clipping path ID

properties.name: seriesClipPath
properties.description: A more restricting clip path used to limit where the series are being drawn

properties.name: seriesId
properties.description: A unique ID for each line series

properties.name: _dynamicProperties
properties.description: A list of the dynamic properties

properties.name: domainChanged
properties.description:
Boolean switching when the domain(s) has(have) changed

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw

properties.name: preventInitialDrawing
properties.description: blocks initial drawings of axis until set to false

properties.name: areaPath
properties.description: A holder object for the series object

properties.name: areaBuilder
properties.description: A holder object for the series builder

properties.name: areaGroup
properties.description: A holder object for the series group

properties.name: drawDebounceTime
properties.description: Debounce time to use for drawing

methods.name: generateRandomID
methods.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

methods.name: cloneSVGElem
methods.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

methods.name: _drawSVGOnCanvas
methods.description: Draws the current svg into a canvas

methods.name: _drawCanvg
methods.description:
Uses canvg third party to "translate" svg to javascript instructions
for the canvas, and draw on the canvas

methods.name: _nativeDrawSvgOnCanvas
methods.description: Tries to draw the SVG to canvas and if that doesnt work, falls back on a failure callback

methods.name: _getSVGOuterHtml
methods.description: fix for IE to get outer HTML

methods.name: _processYValues
methods.description:
This functions process Y axis and applies the result to some variable.
If in single Y it just run the function and assign the result to `result`, if multi Y
it runs the function for each axis and stores the result against the axis key
on `result`

methods.name: _isValidData
methods.description: returns true if the data is valid: non NaN, null or undefined

methods.name: _isDataNotNull
methods.description: returns true if the data is not null

methods.name: _isObjEmpty
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is empty

methods.name: _isD3Empty
methods.description: Checks to see if an d3 obj is empty

methods.name: _doesD3HaveValues
methods.description: Checks to see if an d3 obj has something

methods.name: _doesObjHaveValues
methods.description: Checks to see if an object has values

methods.name: _isVarDefined
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is defined

methods.name: _isVarUndefined
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is defined

methods.name: _escapeCssSelector
methods.description: escapes '.' in css selectors so that we can appropriately select stuff with dots in thei ids

methods.name: _checkThemeVariable
methods.description: Checks if a theme variable exists, if so, returns the theme value, if not, returns the default

methods.name: _checkColorType
methods.description: Checks if a color is already hex or rgb, if must be a colors obj

methods.name: _hexToRgb
methods.description: converts a hex to rgb color

methods.name: _binarySearch
methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData

methods.name: _fuzzyBinarySearch
methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData returning all vals within a window

methods.name: clone
methods.description: deep-copy object into newObject

methods.name: addClipPath
methods.description: Add the clip-path attr to the element

methods.name: _computeValue
methods.description: Decides if it should use a default or user specified value

methods.name: _processConfig
methods.description: sets each property listed in dynamicProperies

methods.name: _watchConfigProperty
methods.description: Cycles through properties and adds them to dynamic properties

methods.name: drawElement
methods.description:
Draws or updates the line element.
Called from an observer watching for data and the necessary d3 objects

methods.name: _addClipPath
methods.description: Helper to call addClipPath with the element

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

properties.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

properties.name: _defaultMargin
properties.description: Copy of the default margin for checking if it has changed

properties.name: margin
properties.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

properties.name: offset
properties.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

properties.name: svg
properties.description:
Holder for the d3 instantiated svg container.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know where to draw.

FUTURE: when Polymer supports SVG, this only needs to be set on the SVG element.

store on detached

attributes.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

attributes.name: canvas-context
attributes.description:
canvasContext is a holder for the instantiated canvas context to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

attributes.name: canvas-layers
attributes.description: An array of the generated layers

attributes.name: svg
attributes.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

attributes.name: px-svg-elem
attributes.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

attributes.name: px-svg-elem-lower
attributes.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element. Used when there are two svgs in a chart

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-svg
      width="[[width]]"
      height="[[height]]"
      margin="[[margin]]"
      svg="{{svg}}">
    </px-vis-svg>
    <px-vis-scale
      x-axis-type="time"
      y-axis-type="linear"
      complete-series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
      data-extents="[[dataExtents]]"
      width="[[width]]"
      height="[[height]]"
      margin="[[margin]]"
      chart-data={{chartData}}
      x="{{x}}"
      y="{{y}}"
      selected-domain="[[selectedDomain]]">
    </px-vis-scale>
    <px-vis-line-svg
      svg="[[svg]]"
      series-id="mySeries"
      complete-series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
      chart-data="[[chartData]]"
      x="[[x]]"
      y="[[y]]"
      domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]">
    </px-vis-line-svg>

properties.name: svg
properties.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

properties.name: _uniqueIdsUsed
properties.description:
Array of unique IDs generated for this comp. cleaned from global
store on detached

properties.name: pxSvgElem
properties.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

properties.name: chartData
properties.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

properties.name: interpolationFunction
properties.description:
A d3 function used to interpolate the series lines.

Can also be a string referencing simple, built in d3 functions:
- `"curveBasis"`
- `"curveBasisClosed"`
- `"curveBasisOpen"`
- `"curveLinear"`
- `"curveLinearClosed"`
- `"curveMonotoneX"`
- `"curveMonotoneY"`
- `"curveNatural"`
- `"curveStep"`
- `"curveStepAfter"`
- `"curveStepBefore"`

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-shape/blob/master/README.md#curves

properties.name: lineRadiusLimit
properties.description:
sets a minimum value for the line amplitude. Points less than the lineRadiusLimit will be set to the limit

Essentially, it moves a point that is past the center into the visible axis area on the opposite side to terminating inside the clip path area, thereby also changing the angle of those connecting lines

Note: radius on a radialLine is equivelent to y on a cartesean line.

properties.name: line
properties.description: A holder object for the line generator

properties.name: seriesId
properties.description: A unique ID for each line series

properties.name: showGaps
properties.description: A boolean spcifying if the line should show gaps on undefined data.

properties.name: parallelCoordinates
properties.description: A dev set boolean specifying if the chart is for a parallel coordinates chart

properties.name: radialLine
properties.description: A dev set boolean specifying if the line is using radial(polar) data

properties.name: gradientLine
properties.description: A boolean spceifying if a opacity gradient should get applied to the line

properties.name: gradientRange
properties.description: Calculated range values for the gradient scale

properties.name: _colorArr
properties.description: Gets and saves the rgb so we can make an rgba to apply to the line

properties.name: multiPath
properties.description: A boolean spcifying if multiple paths get drawn by the line

properties.name: _currentDrawingOptions
properties.description: Object used to store various info about current rendering state

properties.name: x
properties.description:
x is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

properties.name: y
properties.description:
y is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

properties.name: mutedSeries
properties.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

properties.name: clipPath
properties.description: Holder for a clipping path ID

properties.name: seriesClipPath
properties.description: A more restricting clip path used to limit where the series are being drawn

properties.name: selectedDomain
properties.description:
New chart extents selected by the user

Serves as a trigger for the scale component to redefine the chart extents

properties.name: counterClockwise
properties.description: whether the polar data should be interpreted clockwise or counter-clockwise

properties.name: useDegrees
properties.description: Whether the angle data should be processed as degrees, as opposed to be processed as radians

properties.name: _dynamicProperties
properties.description: A list of the dynamic properties

properties.name: serieToRedrawOnTop
properties.description:
Array containing a set of series to redraw on top of everything (in the order
they are found in this array)

properties.name: domainChanged
properties.description:
Boolean switching when the domain(s) has(have) changed

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw

properties.name: preventInitialDrawing
properties.description: blocks initial drawings of axis until set to false

properties.name: _isAttached
properties.description: Boolean tracking if we are attached

properties.name: linePath
properties.description: A holder object for the series object.

properties.name: lineBuilder
properties.description: A holder object for the series builder.

properties.name: lineGroup
properties.description: A holder object for the series group.

properties.name: mutedOpacity
properties.description:
The opacity value of the fill to be used when muting a series (stroke is not drawn on mute).
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig.

properties.name: drawDebounceTime
properties.description: Debounce time to use for drawing.

methods.name: generateRandomID
methods.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

methods.name: cloneSVGElem
methods.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

Uses canvg third party to "translate" svg to javascript instructions
for the canvas, and draw on the canvas

methods.name: _nativeDrawSvgOnCanvas
methods.description: Tries to draw the SVG to canvas and if that doesnt work, falls back on a failure callback

methods.name: _getSVGOuterHtml

methods.name: _defineRadialLine

methods.name: _opacityLine

methods.name: _computeGradientRange

methods.name: _defineSingleLine
methods.description: Defines the d3 line generator and its attrs

methods.name: _defineMultiLine
methods.description: Defines a multi-scale d3 line generator and its attrs

methods.name: _processYValues
methods.description:
This functions process Y axis and applies the result to some variable.
If in single Y it just run the function and assign the result to `result`, if multi Y
it runs the function for each axis and stores the result against the axis key
on `result`

methods.name: _adjustAngleForPolarChart

adjusts the angle for the polar chart, taking counterClockwise into account

methods.name: _computeValue

Draws or updates the line element.

methods.description: Returns the opacity for the SVG line.

methods.description: Redraw this series on top if needed.

elements.description:
### Minimal instantiation

  <px-vis-svg
    width="[[width]]"
    height="[[height]]"
    margin="[[margin]]"
    svg="{{svg}}">
  </px-vis-svg>
  <px-vis-scale
    x-axis-type="time"
    y-axis-type="linear"
    complete-series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
    data-extents="[[dataExtents]]"
    width="[[width]]"
    height="[[height]]"
    margin="[[margin]]"
    chart-data={{chartData}}
    x="{{x}}"
    y="{{y}}"
    domain-changed="{{domainChanged}}">
  </px-vis-scale>
  <px-vis-axis
    svg="[[svg]]"
    axis="[[y]]"
    margin="[[margin]]"
    width="[[width]]"
    height="[[height]]"
    title="myTitle"
    orientation="left"
    label-position="center"
    complete-series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
    muted-series=[[mutedSeries]]
    domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]">
  </px-vis-axis>


### d3 reference
https://github.com/mbostock/d3/wiki/SVG-Axes

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
  `--px-vis-font-family` | The font family for all labels and text
  `--px-vis-axis-color` | The color for the axis lines, axis ticks, and axis tick labels
  `--px-vis-axis-title-color` | The color for the axis title
  `--px-vis-axis-inline-title-color` | The color for the axis title
  `--px-vis-axis-inline-type-color` | The color for the axis lines, axis ticks, and axis tick labels when using 'inline' labelPosition
  `--px-vis-axis-inline-box-color` | The color for the tick boxes when using 'inline' labelPosition

properties.name: svg
properties.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

properties.name: _uniqueIdsUsed
properties.description:
Array of unique IDs generated for this comp. cleaned from global
store on detached

properties.name: pxSvgElem
properties.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

properties.name: _defaultMargin
properties.description: Copy of the default margin for checking if it has changed

properties.name: margin
properties.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

properties.name: offset
properties.description: Translation offset to apply to the axis

properties.name: orientation
properties.description:
Defines which side the axis should be on.
 - 'left'
 - 'right'
 - 'bottom'
 - 'top'

properties.name: axis
properties.description:
axis is a general holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Can pass any type of instantiated scale object, IE pass in either your x or your y depending which this axis is for.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-axis

properties.name: labelTypeSize
properties.description: Defines the base label type size

properties.name: title
properties.description: The displayed title for the axis

properties.name: labelPosition
properties.description:
Defines on which side the tick mark the label should sit.
 - 'center'
 - 'before'
 - 'after'

properties.name: labelRotation
properties.description: Defines how the label should be rotated. Number is the degree of rotation

properties.name: labelTranslation
properties.description: Defines how the label should be moved in x,y. Array is an x,y pair and coresponds to the number of pixels to move the label

properties.name: series
properties.description: Array of the series which belong to this axis

properties.name: translateAmt
properties.description: An x,y amount to move the axis to allow for labels and titles

properties.name: titleLocation
properties.description:
Optional object to specify placement of the title. If none is supplied, then it uses `orientation` to determine title location.

```
   {
     x: Number, // a x number of pixels
     y: Number, // a y number of pixels
     r: Number, // a number of degrees to rotate
     anchor: String, // middle, start, end
   }
```

properties.name: titleTypeSize
properties.description: Defines the Title type size

properties.name: strokeWidth
properties.description: Defines the axis stroke width

properties.name: outerTickSize
properties.description:
Defines the axis outerTickSize. Default is to hide them

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_tickSizeOuter

properties.name: tickValues
properties.description:
Defines the what values the axis should use

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_tickValues

properties.name: ticks
properties.description:
Defines the tick number and format

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_ticks

Can be either a Number or an Object

Obj format:
```
   {
        "interval": Number,
        "format": String or d3 object,
   }
```

properties.name: axisColor
properties.description: Defines the color for axis lines, ticks, labels, and title

properties.name: drawnTickValues
properties.description: Returned tick values from the axis

properties.name: truncationLength
properties.description:
Defines if the label should get truncated and to how many characters.

Default length is 10 characters, not including the ellipsis which gets inserted.

The length must be at least 2.

To disable truncation, set the value to -1

properties.name: domainChanged
properties.description:
Boolean switching when the domain(s) has(have) changed

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw

properties.name: preventInitialDrawing
properties.description: blocks initial drawings of axis until set to false

properties.name: _isAttached
properties.description: Boolean tracking if we are attached

properties.name: _axis
properties.description: Holder for the instantiated d3 axis

properties.name: _axisGroup
properties.description: Holder for the axis drawing

properties.name: axisId
properties.description: A unique ID for the axis

properties.name: displayedTitle
properties.description: The truncated title

properties.name: appendUnitInTitle
properties.description: Whether to append a unit (if existing in config) in the title

properties.name: preventSeriesBar
properties.description: Boolean which specifies not to draw the series bars

properties.name: titleDrawn
properties.description: A boolean specifying if the axis title has been drawn

properties.name: seriesId
properties.description: The series ID this axis refers to, used to look in the config

properties.name: _currentUnits
properties.description: The text representing the units of the axis

properties.name: titleTruncation
properties.description: A boolean specifying if the axis title should truncate when too long

properties.name: _titleTruncated
properties.description: Whether the title has been truncated

properties.name: tickFormat
properties.description:
A string that specifies the format of the ticks

https://github.com/d3/d3-format

https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format

properties.name: axisType
properties.description:
A string specifying the type of axis. Used only for tick formating. Valid entries are:
- `time`
- `linear`
- `ordinal`

properties.name: rotation
properties.description: Rotation to apply to the axis, in degrees

properties.name: disableTicks
properties.description: A boolean specifying whether the axis should have ticks or not

properties.name: _titleGroup
properties.description: Holder for the title group

methods.name: _truncateName
methods.description:
_truncateName takes a string and string length [optional].
Returns a truncated string with the middle replaced by an ellipsis. The ellipsis does not count towards the total character count.
Follows these truncation principles: http://www.gesdh.com/predix/product/principles/truncation/
Example: LNG_BAH_HOT_EFFECTIVENESS_CORE8 --> LNG_B...CORE8

Length cannot be less than 2 characters.
Default length is 10 characters.

If the string is less than or equal to the length or the length is invalid, returns the original string.

attributes.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

attributes.name: margin
attributes.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

attributes.name: offset
attributes.description: Translation offset to apply to the axis

attributes.name: orientation
attributes.description:
Defines which side the axis should be on.
 - 'left'
 - 'right'
 - 'bottom'
 - 'top'

attributes.name: axis
attributes.description:
axis is a general holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Can pass any type of instantiated scale object, IE pass in either your x or your y depending which this axis is for.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-axis

attributes.name: label-type-size
attributes.description: Defines the base label type size

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: The displayed title for the axis

attributes.name: label-position
attributes.description:
Defines on which side the tick mark the label should sit.
 - 'center'
 - 'before'
 - 'after'

attributes.name: label-rotation
attributes.description: Defines how the label should be rotated. Number is the degree of rotation

attributes.name: label-translation
attributes.description: Defines how the label should be moved in x,y. Array is an x,y pair and coresponds to the number of pixels to move the label

attributes.name: series
attributes.description: Array of the series which belong to this axis

attributes.name: translate-amt
attributes.description: An x,y amount to move the axis to allow for labels and titles

attributes.name: title-location
attributes.description:
Optional object to specify placement of the title. If none is supplied, then it uses `orientation` to determine title location.

```
   {
     x: Number, // a x number of pixels
     y: Number, // a y number of pixels
     r: Number, // a number of degrees to rotate
     anchor: String, // middle, start, end
   }
```

attributes.name: title-type-size
attributes.description: Defines the Title type size

attributes.name: stroke-width
attributes.description: Defines the axis stroke width

attributes.name: outer-tick-size
attributes.description:
Defines the axis outerTickSize. Default is to hide them

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_tickSizeOuter

attributes.name: tick-values
attributes.description:
Defines the what values the axis should use

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_tickValues

attributes.name: ticks
attributes.description:
Defines the tick number and format

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_ticks

Can be either a Number or an Object

Obj format:
```
   {
        "interval": Number,
        "format": String or d3 object,
   }
```

attributes.name: axis-color
attributes.description: Defines the color for axis lines, ticks, labels, and title

attributes.name: drawn-tick-values
attributes.description: Returned tick values from the axis

attributes.name: truncation-length
attributes.description:
Defines if the label should get truncated and to how many characters.

Default length is 10 characters, not including the ellipsis which gets inserted.

The length must be at least 2.

To disable truncation, set the value to -1

attributes.name: domain-changed
attributes.description:
Boolean switching when the domain(s) has(have) changed

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw

attributes.name: prevent-initial-drawing
attributes.description: blocks initial drawings of axis until set to false

attributes.name: axis-id
attributes.description: A unique ID for the axis

attributes.name: displayed-title
attributes.description: The truncated title

attributes.name: append-unit-in-title
attributes.description: Whether to append a unit (if existing in config) in the title

attributes.name: prevent-series-bar
attributes.description: Boolean which specifies not to draw the series bars

attributes.name: title-drawn
attributes.description: A boolean specifying if the axis title has been drawn

attributes.name: series-id
attributes.description: The series ID this axis refers to, used to look in the config

attributes.name: title-truncation
attributes.description: A boolean specifying if the axis title should truncate when too long

attributes.name: tick-format
attributes.description:
A string that specifies the format of the ticks

https://github.com/d3/d3-format

https://github.com/d3/d3-time-format

attributes.name: axis-type
attributes.description:
A string specifying the type of axis. Used only for tick formating. Valid entries are:
- `time`
- `linear`
- `ordinal`

attributes.name: rotation
attributes.description: Rotation to apply to the axis, in degrees

attributes.name: disable-ticks
attributes.description: A boolean specifying whether the axis should have ticks or not

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-brush
      svg="[[svg]]"
      axis="[[x]]"
      height="[[height]]"
      width="[[width]]"
      margin="[[margin]]"
      domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]">
    </px-vis-brush>
    <px-vis-svg
      width="[[width]]"
      height="[[height]]"
      margin="[[margin]]"
      svg="{{svg}}">
    </px-vis-svg>
    <px-vis-scale
      x-axis-type="time"
      y-axis-type="linear"
      complete-series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
      data-extents="[[dataExtents]]"
      width="[[width]]"
      height="[[height]]"
      margin="[[margin]]"
      chart-data="[[chartData]]"
      x="{{x}}"
      y="{{y}}"
      domain-changed="{{domainChanged}}">
    </px-vis-scale>

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
  `--px-vis-nav-brush-outline-color` | The stroke (border) color for the brushed box
  `--px-vis-nav-brush-fill-color` | The fill (background) color for the brushed box
  `--px-vis-nav-brush-opacity` | The opacity of the brushed box
  `--px-vis-nav-brush-gradient-fill-color` | The fill (background) color for the brushed box when gradientOverlay is 'true'
  `--px-vis-nav-brush-gradient-opacity-1` | The start opacity of the brushed box when gradientOverlay is 'true'
  `--px-vis-nav-brush-gradient-opacity-2` | The end opacity of the brushed box when gradientOverlay is 'true'
  `--px-vis-nav-brush-handle-fill-color` | The fill (background) color for the handles on the brushed box
  `--px-vis-nav-brush-handle-lines-color` | The stroke (border) color for the handles on the brushed box
  `--px-vis-nav-brush-handle-fill-color-hover` | The hover state fill (background) color for the handles on the brushed box
  `--px-vis-nav-brush-handle-lines-color-hover` | The hover state stroke (border) color for the handles on the brushed box
  `--px-vis-nav-brush-handle-fill-color-press` | The pressed/mousedown state fill (background) color for the handles on the brushed box
  `--px-vis-nav-brush-handle-lines-color-press` | The pressed/mousedown state stroke (border) color for the handles on the brushed box

methods.name: generateRandomID
methods.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

methods.name: cloneSVGElem
methods.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

methods.name: _drawSVGOnCanvas
methods.description: Draws the current svg into a canvas

methods.name: _drawCanvg
methods.description:
Uses canvg third party to "translate" svg to javascript instructions
for the canvas, and draw on the canvas

methods.name: _nativeDrawSvgOnCanvas
methods.description: Tries to draw the SVG to canvas and if that doesnt work, falls back on a failure callback

methods.name: _getSVGOuterHtml
methods.description: fix for IE to get outer HTML

methods.name: _isObjEmpty
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is empty

methods.name: _isD3Empty
methods.description: Checks to see if an d3 obj is empty

methods.name: _doesD3HaveValues
methods.description: Checks to see if an d3 obj has something

methods.name: _doesObjHaveValues
methods.description: Checks to see if an object has values

methods.name: _isVarDefined
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is defined

methods.name: _isVarUndefined
methods.description: Checks to see if an object is defined

methods.name: _escapeCssSelector
methods.description: escapes '.' in css selectors so that we can appropriately select stuff with dots in thei ids

methods.name: _checkThemeVariable
methods.description: Checks if a theme variable exists, if so, returns the theme value, if not, returns the default

methods.name: _checkColorType
methods.description: Checks if a color is already hex or rgb, if must be a colors obj

methods.name: _hexToRgb
methods.description: converts a hex to rgb color

methods.name: _binarySearch
methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData

methods.name: _fuzzyBinarySearch
methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData returning all vals within a window

methods.name: clone
methods.description: deep-copy object into newObject

methods.name: drawElement
methods.description:
Defines the svg for the brush, draws brush elements, and sets up listeners.

Can be called manually after svg and domainChanged are set.

methods.name: _brushstart
methods.description: Helper function to add class "selecting" to elements selected in the brush

methods.name: _brushend
methods.description: Helper function to remove class "selecting" to elements not selected in the brush

methods.name: _brushmove
methods.description:
Helper function fired when the brush is moved / extents are changed.
Sets the attribute 'selectedDomain' with the new extents.
This attr should travel up the component tree via observers and set the new domain in the chart.

methods.name: _brushcenter
methods.description: Helper function fired when the navigator is clicked on

methods.name: _brushcentermove
methods.description: Helper function to calculate the center point where the brush should move to

methods.name: _brushcenterend
methods.description: Helper function to move the brush and disable listener

methods.name: _recenter
methods.description: Helper function to tween and calculate the brush move

methods.name: tween
methods.description: Helper function to tween so that the brush slides rather than jumps

methods.name: _drawHandles
methods.description: Helper function to draw the handle elements

methods.name: _handleGroupMouseDown
methods.description: Function to restyle handles on mousedown event

methods.name: _handleGroupMouseUp
methods.description: Function to restyle handles on mouseup event

methods.name: _handleGroupMouseLeave
methods.description: Function to restyle handles on mouseleave event

methods.name: _handleGroupMouseEnter
methods.description: Function to restyle handles on mouseenter event

methods.name: _zoomBrush
methods.description: Function to trigger a brush extent calculation when the main chart extents change.
