properties.name: crosshairData
generatingCrosshairData
properties.description: Bool indicating if interaction space is currently generating data

properties.name: crosshairPixelSearch
properties.description:
Allows the crosshair to search all datapoints within a pixel radius. If set
to 0 will only pick up the closest point

properties.name: seriesId
properties.description: A unique ID for each line series

properties.name: clipPath
properties.description: Holder for a clipping path ID

properties.name: seriesClipPath
properties.description: A more restricting clip path used to limit where the series are being drawn

properties.name: mutedSeries
properties.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

properties.name: domainChanged
properties.description:
Boolean switching when the domain(s) has(have) changed

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw

properties.name: _dynamicProperties
properties.description: A list of the dynamic properties

properties.name: counterClockwise
properties.description: whether the polar data should be interpreted clockwise or counter-clockwise

properties.name: useDegrees
properties.description: Whether the angle data should be processed as degrees, as opposed to be processed as radians

properties.name: differentDataset
properties.description:
Boolean indicating if the dataset on this chart is different than the one on the crosshairData's origin chart.

NOTE: The chartData passed into the chart MUST be sorted by the timeData for differentDataset to work. This component will not work with unsorted data.

properties.name: fuzz
properties.description: The amount +/- around the datapoint

properties.name: timeData
properties.description: Name of the variable holding the time stamp in the data

properties.name: layersToMask
properties.description: The layers where the series are drawn if you want them to mute on crosshair data

properties.name: drawWithLocalCrosshairData
properties.description: By default, a highlighter will not react to crosshairData if generatingCrosshairData is true. This boolean forces it to draw the crosshairData regardless of the value of generatingCrosshairData

properties.name: _defaultMargin
properties.description: Copy of the default margin for checking if it has changed

properties.name: margin
properties.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

properties.name: parallelCoordinates
properties.description: A dev set boolean specifying if the chart is for a parallel coordinates chart

properties.name: radialLine
properties.description: A dev set boolean specifying if the line is using radial(polar) data

properties.name: tooltipData
defaultEmptyData
properties.description: The "empty" dataset that should be used for tooltipData when not hovering

properties.description:
A d3 function used to interpolate the series lines.

- `"curveBasis"`
- `"curveBasisClosed"`
- `"curveBasisOpen"`
- `"curveLinear"`
- `"curveLinearClosed"`
- `"curveMonotoneX"`
- `"curveMonotoneY"`
- `"curveNatural"`

- `"curveStepBefore"`

methods.name: _processYValues
methods.description:
This functions process Y axis and applies the result to some variable.
If in single Y it just run the function and assign the result to `result`, if multi Y
it runs the function for each axis and stores the result against the axis key
on `result`

methods.name: _fuzzyBinarySearch
methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData returning all vals within a window

methods.name: clone
methods.description: deep-copy object into newObject

methods.name: addClipPath
methods.description: Add the clip-path attr to the element

methods.name: _computeValue
methods.description: Decides if it should use a default or user specified value

methods.name: _processConfig
methods.description: sets each property listed in dynamicProperies

methods.name: _watchConfigProperty
methods.description: Cycles through properties and adds them to dynamic properties

methods.name: _adjustAngleForPolarChart
methods.description:
adjusts the angle for the polar chart, taking counterClockwise into account

methods.name: _computeChartData
methods.description:
Draws the crosshair elements and sets up listeners and callbacks on chart hover
Sets the crosshairData property which gets passed to the register.

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-svg
        ...
        svg="{{svg}}">
    </px-vis-svg>
    <px-vis-scale
        ...
        x="{{x}}"
        y="{{y}}"
        domain-changed="{{domainChanged}}">
    </px-vis-scale>
    <px-vis-interaction-space
        ...
        generating-crosshair-data="{{generatingCrosshairData}}"
        crosshair-data="{{crosshairData}}">
    </px-vis-interaction-space>

    <px-vis-highlight-line
        id="highlighter"
        margin="[[margin]]"
        svg="[[layer.1]]"
        layers-to-mask="[[layer.0]]"
        x="[[x]]"
        y="[[y]]"
        parallel-coordinates
        dimensions="[[dimensions]]"
        domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]"
        time-data="[[seriesKey]]"
        complete-series-config="[[completeSeriesConfig]]"
        series-id="[[seriesKey]]"
        category-key="[[categoryKey]]"
        categories="[[categories]]"
        chart-data="[[chartData]]"
        generating-crosshair-data="[[generatingCrosshairData]]"
        crosshair-data="[[crosshairData]]"
        default-empty-data="{{defaultEmptyData}}">
    </px-vis-highlight-line>

methods.description:

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

methods.name: cloneSVGElem
methods.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

methods.description:
Uses canvg third party to "translate" svg to javascript instructions
for the canvas, and draw on the canvas

methods.name: _nativeDrawSvgOnCanvas
methods.description: Tries to draw the SVG to canvas and if that doesnt work, falls back on a failure callback

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-scale
      x-axis-type="time"
      y-axis-type="linear"
      complete-series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
      data-extents="[[dataExtents]]"
      width="[[width]]"
      height="[[height]]"
      margin="[[margin]]"
      chart-data="{{chartData}}"
      x="{{x}}"
      y="{{y}}"
      domain-changed="{{domainChanged}}"
      selected-domain="[[selectedDomain]]">
    </px-vis-scale>
    <px-vis-svg
      width="[[width]]"
      height="[[height]]"
      margin="[[margin]]"
      svg="{{svg}}">
    </px-vis-svg>
    <px-vis-scatter-canvas
      svg="[[svg]]"
      series-id="mySeries"
      complete-series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
      chart-data="[[chartData]]"
      width="[[width]]"
      height="[[height]]"
      margin="[[margin]]"
      x="[[x]]"
      y="[[y]]"
      domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]">
    </px-vis-scatter-canvas>

properties.name: lineRadiusLimit
properties.description:
sets a minimum value for the line amplitude. Points less than the lineRadiusLimit will be set to the limit

Essentially, it moves a point that is past the center into the visible axis area on the opposite side to terminating inside the clip path area, thereby also changing the angle of those connecting lines

Note: radius on a radialLine is equivelent to y on a cartesean line.

properties.name: line
properties.description: A holder object for the line generator

properties.name: tooltipData
defaultEmptyData
properties.description: The "empty" dataset that should be used for tooltipData when not hovering

properties.name: domainChanged
properties.description:
Boolean switching when the domain(s) has(have) changed

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw

properties.name: counterClockwise
properties.description: whether the polar data should be interpreted clockwise or counter-clockwise

properties.name: useDegrees
properties.description: Whether the angle data should be processed as degrees, as opposed to be processed as radians

properties.name: seriesId
properties.description: A unique ID for each line series

properties.name: _dynamicProperties
properties.description: A list of the dynamic properties

properties.name: serieToRedrawOnTop
properties.description:
Array containing a set of series to redraw on top of everything (in the order
they are found in this array)

properties.name: preventInitialDrawing
properties.description: blocks initial drawings of axis until set to false

properties.name: _isAttached
properties.description: Boolean tracking if we are attached

properties.name: markerMapping
properties.description:
Maps dev input marker string to d3 symbols.

To add additional, custom icons, provide a draw function wrapped in an object and draw your shape using canvas drawing methods. See 'bar' or 'x' as examples

properties.name: markerSymbol
properties.description:
The symbol used for the marker. Supported symbols:
- 'circle'
- 'cross'
- 'diamond'
- 'square'
- 'triangle-up'
- 'star'
- 'wye'
more info at https://github.com/d3/d3-shape/blob/master/README.md#symbols
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

Some additional "custom" types are also available:
- 'bar'
- 'thin-bar'
- 'thick-bar'
- 'x'

properties.name: markerScale
properties.description:
Scales the size of the scatter marker
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

properties.name: markerSize
properties.description:
the size of the markers
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

properties.name: markerFillOpacity
properties.description:
The opacity of the fill (inside) of the marker
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

properties.name: markerStrokeOpacity
properties.description:
The opacity of the stroke (outside) of the marker
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

properties.name: mutedOpacity
properties.description:
the opacity value of the fill to be used when muting a serie (stroke is not drawn on mute)
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

properties.name: rendererType
properties.description:
Type of renderer this drawing element should be using. Determines on what
condition the element is going to be drawn
- chartData
- filteredChartData
- highlightData

properties.name: seriesNumber
properties.description: The index of the series, used for calculating its color.

properties.name: radial
properties.description: Whether the scatter plot is using radial coordinates (x=phase, y=amplitude).

properties.name: timeData
properties.description: Name of the variable holding the time stamp in the data. Used for non-timeseries charts.

properties.name: _currentDrawingOptions
properties.description: Options currently in use for drawing scatter: opacity, symbol, drawing function, etc.

properties.name: clipPath
properties.description: Whether to use the clipPath to avoid drawing outside of the axes.

methods.name: _processYValues
methods.description:
This functions process Y axis and applies the result to some variable.
If in single Y it just run the function and assign the result to `result`, if multi Y
it runs the function for each axis and stores the result against the axis key
on `result`

attributes.name: canvas-context
attributes.description:
canvasContext is a holder for the instantiated canvas context to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

attributes.name: canvas-layers
attributes.description: An array of the generated layers

attributes.name: x
attributes.description:
x is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

attributes.description:
y is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object

attributes.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

attributes.name: muted-series
attributes.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

attributes.name: interpolation-function
attributes.description:
A d3 function used to interpolate the series lines.

Can also be a string referencing simple, built in d3 functions:
- `"curveBasis"`
- `"curveBasisClosed"`
- `"curveBasisOpen"`
- `"curveLinear"`
- `"curveLinearClosed"`
- `"curveMonotoneX"`
- `"curveMonotoneY"`
- `"curveNatural"`
- `"curveStep"`
- `"curveStepAfter"`
- `"curveStepBefore"`

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-shape/blob/master/README.md#curves

attributes.name: line-radius-limit
attributes.description:
sets a minimum value for the line amplitude. Points less than the lineRadiusLimit will be set to the limit

Essentially, it moves a point that is past the center into the visible axis area on the opposite side to terminating inside the clip path area, thereby also changing the angle of those connecting lines

Note: radius on a radialLine is equivelent to y on a cartesean line.

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-svg
        ...
        svg="{{svg}}">
    </px-vis-svg>
    <px-vis-scale
        ...
        x="{{x}}"
        y="{{y}}"
        domain-changed="{{domainChanged}}">
    </px-vis-scale>
    <px-vis-interaction-space
        ...
        generating-crosshair-data="{{generatingCrosshairData}}"
        crosshair-data="{{crosshairData}}">
    </px-vis-interaction-space>

    <px-vis-highlight-point-canvas
        svg="[[svg]]"
        x="[[x]]"
        y="[[y]]"
        domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]"
        time-data="[[key]]"
        complete-series-config="[[completeSeriesConfig]]"
        chart-data="[[chartData]]"
        generating-crosshair-data="[[generatingCrosshairData]]"
        crosshair-data="[[crosshairData]]">
    </px-vis-highlight-point-canvas>

properties.description: The layers where the series are drawn if you want them to mute on crosshair data

properties.description: By default, a highlighter will not react to crosshairData if generatingCrosshairData is true. This boolean forces it to draw the crosshairData regardless of the value of generatingCrosshairData

methods.name: generateRandomID
methods.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

methods.name: cloneSVGElem
methods.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

methods.name: _drawSVGOnCanvas
methods.description: Draws the current svg into a canvas

methods.name: _drawCanvg
methods.description:
Uses canvg third party to "translate" svg to javascript instructions

on `result`

attributes.name: muted-series
attributes.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

attributes.name: series-id
attributes.description: A unique ID for each line series

attributes.name: counter-clockwise
attributes.description: whether the polar data should be interpreted clockwise or counter-clockwise

attributes.name: use-degrees
attributes.description: Whether the angle data should be processed as degrees, as opposed to be processed as radians

attributes.name: different-dataset
attributes.description:
Boolean indicating if the dataset on this chart is different than the one on the crosshairData's origin chart.

NOTE: The chartData passed into the chart MUST be sorted by the timeData for differentDataset to work. This component will not work with unsorted data.

attributes.name: fuzz
attributes.description: The amount +/- around the datapoint

attributes.name: layers-to-mask
attributes.description: The layers where the series are drawn if you want them to mute on crosshair data

attributes.name: draw-with-local-crosshair-data
attributes.description: By default, a highlighter will not react to crosshairData if generatingCrosshairData is true. This boolean forces it to draw the crosshairData regardless of the value of generatingCrosshairData

default-empty-data

elements.description:
Sets the tooltipData property, which can then be used to share adjacent datapoint values with other components, such as the register.

### Usage

    <px-vis-interaction-space
        svg="[[svg]]"
        width="[[width]]"
        height="[[height]]"
        margin="[[margin]]"
        chart-data="[[chartData]]"
        x="[[x]]"
        y="[[y]]"
        tooltip-data="{{tooltipData}}"
        extents-data="{{extentsData}}">
    </px-vis-interaction-space>

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
:----------------|:-------------|----------
  `--px-vis-zoom-brush-outline-color` | The stroke (border) color for the on-chart zoom/selection brush | `$grey6`
  `--px-vis-zoom-brush-fill-color` | The fill (background) color for the on-chart zoom/selection brush | `$gray2`
  `--px-vis-zoom-brush-fill-opacity` | The opacity for the on-chart zoom/selection brush | `0.5`

extentsAction
properties.description: Used by the chart to interpret if extentsData is strip or zoom

properties.name: xAxisType
properties.description:
Sets the type of data for the x values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `time`: for time domains.
- `timeLocal`: for local time domains.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

properties.name: yAxisType
properties.description:
Sets the type of data for the y values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

properties.name: seriesKeys
properties.description: Representes the keys avaiable in completeSeriesConfig.

properties.name: selectionType
properties.description:
The zoom selection type:
- xy
- xAxis
- yAxis

properties.name: counterClockwise
properties.description: whether the polar data should be interpreted clockwise or counter-clockwise

properties.name: useDegrees
properties.description: Whether the angle data should be processed as degrees, as opposed to be processed as radians

properties.name: preventWebWorkerSynchronization
properties.description:
Prevents the chart from synchronizing its data with a webworker.
This can be turned on to minimize the memory footprint of the
chart
WARNING: turning the synchronization off will:
- prevent the chart from being able to use crosshair feature
- slow down data search for tooltip/register
- slow down calculating extents for the chart if it needs to

We advise against turning it off but it might be beneficial in
specific scenarios (high number of small charts with minimum
interaction for example)

properties.name: wwDataSyncCounter
properties.description:
Updated every time the chart gets new data and a sync request
to the web worker happened. Use it for triggering observers
instead of chartData if the observer needs the data in the webworker
(i.e kicking another webworker processing)

properties.description: Holder for the interaction rectangle object.

properties.description: An object that contains meta data for the area drawn by the user.

properties.description: The actual mouse svg rectangle which can be used to activate the tooltip.

properties.name: timeData
properties.description: Name of the variable holding the time stamp in the data. Used for non timeseries charts.

properties.name: actionMapping
properties.description: Set of predefined actions that can be used out of the box.

properties.name: actionConfig
properties.description:
Configuration used to define what actions happen on events.
Each key represents an event, each value can be:
- a predefined action found in px-vis-interaction-space `actionMapping`
- a function, where `this` will be bound to the chart and the function's argument will be the mouse position on the chart

properties.description: If false, will pass `hidden: true` in the tooltip data.

properties.name: radial
properties.description: Whether the scatter plot is using radial coordinates (x=phase, y=amplitude).

properties.description: Whether crosshair data is currently being searched for.

properties.description: The search radius for quadtree searches. Only points inside this radius will be returned.

properties.name: chartId
properties.description: Unique ID of the chart owning this interaction space.

properties.description:
Type of cursor drawing to add:

 - 'crosshair' : draws vertical and horizontal line
 - 'circle' : draws circle of size radius

properties.name: useQuadtree
properties.description: Boolean specifying if a quadtree should be created and used for searching.

methods.name: cloneSVGElem
methods.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

methods.name: _finishActionBox
methods.description:
Helper function called on mouseup.action.
Gets the size of the action area rectangle, sets the extents, and removes it.

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-svg
        ...
        svg="{{svg}}">
    </px-vis-svg>
    <px-vis-scale
        ...
        x="{{x}}"
        y="{{y}}"
        domain-changed="{{domainChanged}}">
    </px-vis-scale>
    <px-vis-interaction-space
        ...
        generating-crosshair-data="{{generatingCrosshairData}}"
        crosshair-data="{{crosshairData}}">
    </px-vis-interaction-space>

    <px-vis-markers
        svg="[[svg]]"
        x="[[x]]"
        y="[[y]]"
        domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]"
        time-data="[[key]]"
        complete-series-config="[[completeSeriesConfig]]"
        chart-data="[[chartData]]"
        generating-crosshair-data="[[generatingCrosshairData]]"
        crosshair-data="[[crosshairData]]">
    </px-vis-markers>

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
  `--px-vis-cursor-line-color` | The color for the lines which track the cursor/data

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

attributes.name: margin
attributes.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

attributes.name: offset
attributes.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

attributes.name: canvas-context
attributes.description:
canvasContext is a holder for the instantiated canvas context to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

attributes.name: canvas-layers
attributes.description: An array of the generated layers

attributes.name: x
attributes.description:
x is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

attributes.name: y
attributes.description:
y is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

attributes.name: chart-data
attributes.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

attributes.name: clip-path
attributes.description: Holder for a clipping path ID

attributes.name: series-clip-path
attributes.description: A more restricting clip path used to limit where the series are being drawn

attributes.name: series-id
attributes.description: A unique ID for each line series

elements.description:
### Usage
    <px-vis-axis-interaction-space
        svg="[[svg]]"
        width="[[width]]"
        height="[[height]]"
        margin="[[margin]]"
        x="[[x]]"
        y="[[y]]"
        domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]"
        complete-series-config="[[completeSeriesConfig]]"
        dimension="[[dimension]]"
        dimensions="[[dimensions]]"
        series-key="[[seriesKey]]"
        category-key="[[categoryKey]]"
        chart-data="[[chartData]]"
        muted-series="{{mutedSeries}}"
        radial="[[radial]]"
        center-offset="[[centerOffset]]"
        brush-to-remove="[[brushToRemove]]"
        brush-domains="[[brushDomains]]"
        drag-container-elem="[[dragContainerElem]]"
        cartesian-drag-behavior="[[cartesianDragBehavior]]"
        redraw-series="[[redrawSeries]]"
        dynamic-redraw="[[dynamicRedraw]]"
        action-config="[[actionConfig]]">
    </px-vis-axis-interaction-space>

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
`--px-vis-axis-brush-outline-color` | The stroke (border) color for the brushed box on an axis
`--px-vis-axis-brush-fill-color`  | The fill (background) color for the brushed box on an axis
`--px-vis-axis-brush-fill-opacity`  | The opacity of the brushed box on an axis

properties.name: mutedSeries
properties.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

properties.description: Boolean to specify if we should redraw the chart series when we move an axis. More of a chart type by chart type configuration rather than a developer configuration. properties.name: actionConfig
properties.description:
Configuration used to define what actions happen on events. Each key represents an event,
each value can be:
- a predefined action found in px-vis-interaction-space `actionMapping`
- a function, where `this` will be bound to the chart and the function's argument will be the mouse position on the chart

methods.name: generateRandomID
methods.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

methods.name: cloneSVGElem
methods.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

methods.name: _drawSVGOnCanvas
methods.description: Draws the current svg into a canvas

methods.name: _drawCanvg
methods.description:
Uses canvg third party to "translate" svg to javascript instructions
for the canvas, and draw on the canvas

methods.name: _nativeDrawSvgOnCanvas
methods.description: Tries to draw the SVG to canvas and if that doesnt work, falls back on a failure callback

methods.name: _getSVGOuterHtml
methods.description: fix for IE to get outer HTML

methods.name: _processYValues
methods.description:
This functions process Y axis and applies the result to some variable.
If in single Y it just run the function and assign the result to `result`, if multi Y
it runs the function for each axis and stores the result against the axis key
on `result`

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-interactive-axis
        prevent-initial-drawing="[[preventInitialDrawing]]"
        svg="[[svg]]"
        x="[[x]]"
        y="[[y]]"
        dimension="[[dimension]]"
        series-key="[[seriesKey]]"
        height="[[height]]"
        width="[[width]]"
        margin="[[margin]]"
        chart-data="[[chartData]]"
        orientation="[[orientation]]"
        title="[[title]]"
        title-location='[[titleLocation]]'
        title-type-size="[[titleTypeSize]]"
        label-type-size="[[labelTypeSize]]"
        stroke-width="[[strokeWidth]]"
        outer-tick-size="0"
        tick-values="[[tickValues]]"
        truncation-length="[[truncationLength]]"
        complete-series-config="[[completeSeriesConfig]]"
        append-unit-in-title="[[appendUnitInTitle]]"
        unit="[[unit]]"
        prevent-series-bar="[[preventSeriesBar]]"
        domain-changed="[[_internalDimensionsChanged]]"
        selected-domain="[[selectedDomain]]"
        title-truncation
        disable-ticks="[[disableTicks]]"
        label-position="[[labelPosition]]"
        axis-color="[[axisColor]]"
        ticks="[[ticks]]"
        label-rotation="[[labelRotation]]"
        label-translation="[[labelTranslation]]"
        series-on-axis="[[seriesOnAxes]]"
        muted-series="[[mutedSeries]]"
        drawn-tick-values="[[drawnTickValues]]"
        rebuild-on-draw="[[_rebuildOnDraw]]"
        disable-brush="[[disableBrush]]"
        drag-behavior="[[dragBehavior]]"
        rebuild-on-draw="[[_rebuildOnDraw]]"
        prevent-initial-drawing="[[preventInitialDrawing]]"
        redraw-series="[[redrawSeries]]"
        brush-domains="[[_brushDomains]]"
        hide-and-show-on-hover="[[hideAndShowOnHover]]">
    </px-vis-interactive-axis>

### d3 reference
https://github.com/mbostock/d3/wiki/SVG-Axes

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
  `--px-vis-font-family` | The font family for all labels and text
  `--px-vis-axis-color` | The color for the axis lines, axis ticks, and axis tick labels
  `--px-vis-axis-title-color` | The color for the axis title
  `--px-vis-axis-inline-title-color` | The color for the axis title
  `--px-vis-axis-inline-type-color` | The color for the axis lines, axis ticks, and axis tick labels when using 'inline' labelPosition
  `--px-vis-axis-inline-box-color` | The color for the tick boxes when using 'inline' labelPosition
  `--px-vis-axis-common-tick-color`

svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

properties.name: _uniqueIdsUsed

Array of unique IDs generated for this comp. cleaned from global
store on detached

properties.name: pxSvgElem
properties.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

properties.name: margin
properties.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

properties.name: offset
properties.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

properties.name: labelTypeSize
properties.description: Defines the base label type size

properties.name: title
properties.description: The displayed title for the axis

properties.name: labelPosition
properties.description:
Defines on which side the tick mark the label should sit.
 - 'center'
 - 'before'
 - 'after'

properties.name: labelRotation
properties.description: Defines how the label should be rotated. Number is the degree of rotation

properties.name: labelTranslation
properties.description: Defines how the label should be moved in x,y. Array is an x,y pair and coresponds to the number of pixels to move the label

properties.name: series
properties.description: Array of the series which belong to this axis

properties.name: translateAmt
properties.description: An x,y amount to move the axis to allow for labels and titles

properties.name: titleLocation
properties.description:
Optional object to specify placement of the title. If none is supplied, then it uses `orientation` to determine title location.

```
   {
     x: Number, // a x number of pixels
     y: Number, // a y number of pixels
     r: Number, // a number of degrees to rotate
     anchor: String, // middle, start, end
   }
```

properties.name: titleTypeSize
properties.description: Defines the Title type size

properties.name: strokeWidth
properties.description: Defines the axis stroke width

properties.name: outerTickSize
properties.description:
Defines the axis outerTickSize. Default is to hide them

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_tickSizeOuter

properties.name: tickValues
properties.description:
Defines the what values the axis should use

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_tickValues

properties.name: ticks
properties.description:
Defines the tick number and format

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_ticks

Can be either a Number or an Object

Obj format:
```
   {
        "interval": Number,
        "format": String or d3 object,
   }
```

properties.name: axisColor
properties.description: Defines the color for axis lines, ticks, labels, and title

properties.name: drawnTickValues
properties.description: Returned tick values from the axis

properties.name: chartData
properties.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

properties.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

properties.name: displayedValues
properties.description: Array representing the actual displayed titles for each axis.

properties.name: showTicksOnHover
properties.description: Whether the axis ticks should be hidden and shown on hover, or always shown.

properties.name: disableTicks
properties.description: Boolean to decide if all axes or just one axis should get ticks.

properties.name: length
properties.description: Length of the axis.

properties.name: brushToRemove

properties.name: _pokeTitleLocation
properties.description: Force a redraw for titleLocation.

properties.description: Force a redraw if ticks.

properties.name: preventSeriesBar
properties.description: Boolean to specify whether to draw the series bars.

properties.name: brushDomains

attributes.name: svg
attributes.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

attributes.name: px-svg-elem
attributes.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

attributes.name: margin
attributes.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

attributes.name: offset
attributes.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

attributes.name: label-type-size
attributes.description: Defines the base label type size

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: The displayed title for the axis

attributes.name: label-position
attributes.description:
Defines on which side the tick mark the label should sit.
 - 'center'
 - 'before'
 - 'after'

attributes.name: label-rotation
attributes.description: Defines how the label should be rotated. Number is the degree of rotation

attributes.name: label-translation
attributes.description: Defines how the label should be moved in x,y. Array is an x,y pair and coresponds to the number of pixels to move the label

attributes.name: series
attributes.description: Array of the series which belong to this axis

attributes.name: translate-amt
attributes.description: An x,y amount to move the axis to allow for labels and titles

attributes.name: title-location
attributes.description:
Optional object to specify placement of the title. If none is supplied, then it uses `orientation` to determine title location.

```
   {
     x: Number, // a x number of pixels
     y: Number, // a y number of pixels
     r: Number, // a number of degrees to rotate
     anchor: String, // middle, start, end
   }
```

attributes.name: title-type-size
attributes.description: Defines the Title type size

attributes.name: stroke-width
attributes.description: Defines the axis stroke width

attributes.name: outer-tick-size
attributes.description:
Defines the axis outerTickSize. Default is to hide them

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_tickSizeOuter

attributes.name: tick-values
attributes.description:
Defines the what values the axis should use

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_tickValues

attributes.name: ticks
attributes.description:
Defines the tick number and format

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_ticks

Can be either a Number or an Object

Obj format:
```
   {
        "interval": Number,
        "format": String or d3 object,
   }
```

attributes.name: axis-color
attributes.description: Defines the color for axis lines, ticks, labels, and title

attributes.name: drawn-tick-values
attributes.description: Returned tick values from the axis

attributes.name: chart-data
attributes.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

attributes.name: muted-series
attributes.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

attributes.name: redraw-series
attributes.description: Boolean to specify if we should redraw the chart series when we move an axis. More of a chart type by chart type configuration rather than a developer configuration. IE, for charts such as multi-y timeseries, it is unnessary. For charts such as parallel coordinates, it is necessary.

attributes.name: redraw-elems
attributes.description: The accompanying array of series elements required to redraw.

attributes.name: dynamic-redraw
attributes.description: Boolean specifing if the lines should redraw as you move the axis or just at the end.

attributes.name: common-axis
attributes.description: A boolean specifying if all axes should share the same range

attributes.name: domain-changed
attributes.description:
Boolean switching when the domain(s) has(have) changed

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw

attributes.name: selected-domain
attributes.description:
New chart extents selected by the user

Serves as a trigger for the scale component to redefine the chart extents

attributes.name: radial
attributes.description: Boolean specifying if the chart is a polar chart or a cartesian chart

attributes.name: center-offset
attributes.description: Used in a radial chart to provide a hole in the center of the chart

attributes.name: series-to-axes
attributes.description: Object linking which series belong to which axis

attributes.name: prevent-initial-drawing
attributes.description: blocks initial drawings of axis until set to false

attributes.name: action-config
attributes.description:
Configuration used to define what actions happen on events. Each key represents an event,
each value can be:
- a predefined action found in px-vis-interaction-space `actionMapping`
- a function, where `this` will be bound to the chart and the function's argument will be the mouse position on the chart

attributes.name: dimension
attributes.description: The string identifier for the axis.

attributes.name: append-unit-in-title
attributes.description: Whether to append unit in brackets in axis title, e.g [Hz].

attributes.name: displayed-values
attributes.description: Array representing the actual displayed titles for each axis.

attributes.name: show-ticks-on-hover
attributes.description: Whether the axis ticks should be hidden and shown on hover, or always shown.

attributes.name: disable-ticks
attributes.description: Boolean to decide if all axes or just one axis should get ticks.

attributes.name: length
attributes.description: Length of the axis.

attributes.name: brush-to-remove
attributes.description: Boolean controlling if brushing should retain or delete series.

attributes.name: recalc-ticks
attributes.description: Force a redraw if ticks.

attributes.name: prevent-series-bar
attributes.description: Boolean to specify whether to draw the series bars.

attributes.name: brush-domains
attributes.description: Object to pass in a brush domain.

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-multi-axis
        svg="[[svg]]"
        width="[[width]]"
        height="[[height]]"
        margin="[[margin]]"
        offset="[[_offset]]"
        length="[[_minDim]]"
        x="[[x]]"
        y="[[y]]"
        complete-series-config="{{completeSeriesConfig}}"
        series-key="[[seriesKey]]"
        chart-data="[[chartData]]"
        dimensions="[[dimensions]]"
        axes="[[axes]]"
        muted-series="{{mutedSeriesBrush}}"
        redraw-series="true"
        stroke-width="2"
        match-ticks="[[matchTicks]]"
        grid-ticks="{{gridTicks}}"
        grid-axis="{{gridAxis}}"
        common-axis="[[commonAxis]]"
        truncation-length="[[truncationLength]]"
        displayed-values="{{displayedValues}}"
        append-unit-in-title
        domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]"
        axis-groups="{{axisGroups}}"
        radial
        single-domain
        label-position="inline"
        label-one-axis
        axis-color="grey4"
        ticks="[[ticks]]"
        label-rotation="180"
        brush-to-remove="[[brushToRemove]]"
        center-offset="[[centerOffset]]"
        drawn-tick-values="{{drawnTickValues}}"
        title-type-size="15"
        label-type-size="12">
    </px-vis-multi-axis>

### d3 reference
https://github.com/mbostock/d3/wiki/SVG-Axes

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
  `--px-vis-font-family` | The font family for all labels and text
  `--px-vis-axis-color` | The color for the axis lines, axis ticks, and axis tick labels
  `--px-vis-axis-title-color` | The color for the axis title
  `--px-vis-axis-inline-title-color` | The color for the axis title
  `--px-vis-axis-inline-type-color` | The color for the axis lines, axis ticks, and axis tick labels when using 'inline' labelPosition
  `--px-vis-axis-inline-box-color` | The color for the tick boxes when using 'inline' labelPosition

elements.description:
FIXME STARTED BUT ABANDONED. MAY OR MAY NOT WORK AT THIS POINT.

Interpreter component which creates x & y interpreters.

Interpreter components act as a converter, translating data points into their corresponding pixel coordinate. To do this, the interpreter needs to understand what type of data you have (xScale, yScale), the size of the drawing area you have (width, height, margin), and the extents of your data / domain (chartData, selectedDomain). It then returns the interpreter functions for `x` and `y` and arrays for the current domain those `x` and `y` functions are using.

### Usage

    <px-vis-multi-radial-scale
        width="[[width]]"
        height="[[height]]"
        margin="[[margin]]"
        dimensions="[[dimensions]]"
        chart-data="[[chartData]]"
        complete-series-config="[[completeSeriesConfig]]"
        chart-extents="[[chartExtents]]"
        x="{{x}}"
        y="{{y}}">
    </px-vis-multi-radial-scale>

### d3 Reference
https://github.com/d3/d3/wiki/Scales

https://github.com/d3/d3/wiki/API-Reference#d3scale-scales

elements.description:
This component translates data points into their corresponding pixel coordinates.

To do this, the interpreter needs to understand:

  1. the type of data (xScale, yScale)
  2. the size of the drawing area (width, height, margin)
  3. the data extents and domain (chartData, selectedDomain)

It then returns an array for currentDomain and interpreter functions for `x` and `y` which use the currentDomain array.

### Usage
    <px-vis-multi-scale
      width="[[width]]"
      height="[[height]]"
      margin="[[margin]]"
      axes="[[axes]]"
      chart-data="[[chartData]]"
      chart-extents="[[chartExtents]]"
      x="{{x}}"
      y="{{y}}"
      domain-changed="{{domainChanged}}">
    </px-vis-multi-scale>


### d3 Reference
https://github.com/d3/d3/wiki/Scales

https://github.com/d3/d3/wiki/API-Reference#d3scale-scales

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-pie
        svg="[[svg]]"
        clip-path="[[clipPath]]"
        series-id="[[item.name]]"
        series-number="[[index]]"
        chart-data="[[item]]"
        x="[[x]]"
        y="[[y]]"
        muted-series="[[mutedSeries]]">
    </px-vis-pie>

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
  `--px-vis-pie-empty-color` | The color for an empty pie chart
  `--px-vis-pie-title-color` | The color for the title name
  `--px-vis-pie-title-font-size` | The size for the title name
  `--px-vis-pie-title-value-color` | The color for the title data value
  `--px-vis-pie-title-value-font-size` | The size for the title data value

properties.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

properties.name: mutedSeries
properties.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

properties.name: _defaultMargin
properties.description: Copy of the default margin for checking if it has changed

properties.name: margin
properties.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

properties.name: offset
properties.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

properties.name: seriesColorList
properties.description: Defines an colors in order that will be used for series.

properties.name: empty
properties.description: Whether to draw an empty pie chart when data is empty/null.

properties.name: seriesNumber
properties.description: An index of the series used for calculating its color.

properties.name: innerRadius
properties.description:
Number between 0 and 1 defining how much of the inner pie should be cut.
Typically at 0 this is a pie chart, at 0.5 a donut chart and at 1 all
the chart is cut (i.e. not visible).

properties.name: _innerRadiusPx
properties.description: The actual inner radius value in pixels which will be used internally to draw the chart.

properties.name: donut
properties.description:
Whether the chart should be displayed as a donut rather than a pie.
If displayed as a donut, it will by default use 30px as the ring size.
This can be overridden by using the "innerRadius" property (between 0 and 1).

properties.name: pieGroup
properties.description: A holder object for the series object.

properties.name: total
properties.description: Total value of all slices.

properties.name: radius
properties.description: Radius of the pie chart.

properties.name: _arcs
properties.description: The current arc definitions.

properties.name: _currentRotationAngle
properties.description: How much the pie is currently rotated in radians.

properties.name: usePercentage
properties.description: Whether the values should be displayed in percent.

properties.name: preserveDataOrder
properties.description:
By default the pie chart slices will be ordered by value.
Set to false to keep the data order.

methods.description: Binary search through sorted chartData returning all vals within a window

methods.name: clone
methods.description: deep-copy object into newObject

methods.name: _getColor
methods.description: Helper function to return the correct color for a particular index.

methods.name: _calcIndex
methods.description: Helper function to calculate the index. When we run out of indcies, it loops back over valid indicies.

methods.name: syncCSSTheme
methods.description:
Retrieves the CSS style variables set on this element and applies them
to the appropriate properties, triggering a redraw.

methods.name: _debounceSyncCSSTheme
methods.description:
Debounced function call for `syncCSSTheme` method. Loops through available
style variables to apply them to appropriate objects.

methods.name: _applyStyleVariables
methods.description:
Called when there is at least one style variable applied (the first is
expected to be named `--px-vis-series-color-0`). Loops through each
style variable in the format `--px-vis-series-color-[n]` and applies
the resulting values and series color order to the element. Stops looping
through style variables when it finds a gap.

methods.name: _colorHexToRgb
methods.description: Converts a hex-format color to RGB.

methods.name: _checkIfDevSetSeriesColorOrder
methods.description: Compares seriesColorOrder property value to the seriesColorOrder to determine if the dev set their own override.

methods.name: drawElement
methods.description:
Draws or updates the pie element.
Called from an observer watching for data and the necessary d3 objects.

methods.name: _checkInitialGroupCreation
methods.description:
Checks whether the group holding all of the slices has been created,
and creates it if necessary.

methods.name: _updateDrawing
methods.description: Updates drawing when adding, removing or updating data.

methods.name: _sliceMouseEnter
methods.description: Function used to display a tooltip for a specific slice.

methods.name: _positionChart
methods.description: Position the chart given the rotation angle.

methods.name: _onSliceClick
methods.description: Emits px-vis-pie-slice-clicked event with selected slice data.

methods.name: _centerOnSlice
methods.description: Transforms the svg to show the slice at the top (12 o'clock).

methods.name: _radToDeg
methods.description: Converts radians to degrees.

methods.name: _getRotationAngle
methods.description: Calculates the appropriate rotation angle for the slice to be displayed at 12 o'clock.

attributes.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

attributes.name: offset
attributes.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

attributes.name: series-color-list
attributes.description: Defines an colors in order that will be used for series.

attributes.name: empty
attributes.description: Whether to draw an empty pie chart when data is empty/null.

attributes.name: series-number
attributes.description: An index of the series used for calculating its color.

attributes.name: inner-radius
attributes.description:
Number between 0 and 1 defining how much of the inner pie should be cut.
Typically at 0 this is a pie chart, at 0.5 a donut chart and at 1 all
the chart is cut (i.e. not visible).

attributes.name: donut
attributes.description:
Whether the chart should be displayed as a donut rather than a pie.
If displayed as a donut, it will by default use 30px as the ring size.
This can be overridden by using the "innerRadius" property (between 0 and 1).

attributes.name: pie-group
attributes.description: A holder object for the series object.

attributes.name: total
attributes.description: Total value of all slices.

attributes.name: radius
attributes.description: Radius of the pie chart.

attributes.name: use-percentage
attributes.description: Whether the values should be displayed in percent.

attributes.name: preserve-data-order
attributes.description:
By default the pie chart slices will be ordered by value.
Set to false to keep the data order.

methods.name: generateRandomID
methods.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

methods.name: cloneSVGElem
methods.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

methods.name: _drawSVGOnCanvas
methods.description: Draws the current svg into a canvas

methods.name: _drawCanvg
methods.description:
Uses canvg third party to "translate" svg to javascript instructions
for the canvas, and draw on the canvas

methods.name: _nativeDrawSvgOnCanvas
methods.description: Tries to draw the SVG to canvas and if that doesnt work, falls back on a failure callback

methods.name: _getSVGOuterHtml
methods.description: fix for IE to get outer HTML

methods.name: _processYValues
methods.description:
This functions process Y axis and applies the result to some variable.
If in single Y it just run the function and assign the result to `result`, if multi Y
it runs the function for each axis and stores the result against the axis key
on `result`

properties.name: chartData
properties.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

properties.name: selectedDomain
properties.description:
New chart extents selected by the user

Serves as a trigger for the scale component to redefine the chart extents

properties.name: xAxisType
properties.description:
Sets the type of data for the x values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `time`: for time domains.
- `timeLocal`: for local time domains.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

properties.name: yAxisType
properties.description:
Sets the type of data for the y values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

properties.name: chartExtents
properties.description:
Developer set chart extents for the chart. The chart will draw to whatever values are specified in the chartExtents.
```
 {
     "x": [0,100],
     "y": [5,50],
 }
```

To force the chart to calculate based on data, use "dynamic".
```
 {
     "x": [0,"dynamic"],
     "y": [-10,"dynaimc"],
 }
```

For an ordinal dataset, chart extents can be set like this:
```
 {
     "x": ['low','medium','high'],
     "y": [5,50],
 }
```

properties.name: centerOffset
properties.description: Used in a radial chart to provide a hole in the center of the chart

properties.name: domainChanged
properties.description:
Boolean switching when the domain(s) has(have) changed

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw

properties.name: counterClockwise
properties.description: whether the polar data should be interpreted clockwise or counter-clockwise

properties.name: useDegrees
properties.description: Whether the angle data should be processed as degrees, as opposed to be processed as radians

properties.name: amplitudeKeys
properties.description: Array of the amplitude keys.

properties.name: _calculatedExtents
properties.description: Holder for the calculated extents.

properties.name: radar
properties.description:
Whether the scale is for radar and should use a scalePoint X scale
instead of a scaleLinear.

elements.description:
Interpreter components act as a converter, translating data points into their corresponding pixel coordinate.

To do this, the interpreter needs to understand:
   1. the type of data (xScale, yScale)
   2. the size of the drawing area (width, height, margin)
   3. the extents of the data and domain (chartData, selectedDomain)

It then returns the interpreter functions for `x` and `y`
and arrays for the current domain those `x` and `y` functions are using.

### Usage
    <px-vis-scale
      x-axis-type="time"
      y-axis-type="linear"
      complete-series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
      data-extents="[[dataExtents]]"
      width="[[width]]"
      height="[[height]]"
      margin="[[margin]]"
      chart-data={{chartData}}
      x="{{x}}"
      y="{{y}}"
      domainChanged="{{domainChanged}}"
      selected-domain="[[selectedDomain]]">
    </px-vis-scale>

### d3 Reference
https://github.com/d3/d3/wiki/Scales

https://github.com/d3/d3/wiki/API-Reference#d3scale-scales

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the elem; generally the width of the charting area for most components

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the component; generally the height of the charting area for most components.

properties.name: _defaultMargin
properties.description: Copy of the default margin for checking if it has changed

properties.name: margin
properties.description: Defines the base margin for the chart. Calcs are run to add to the margin to accommodate axes and other elements which exist within the SVG frame, but outside the chart frame.

properties.name: offset
properties.description: An optional offset for a variety of elements

properties.name: x
properties.description:
x is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

properties.name: y
properties.description:
y is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

properties.name: chartData
properties.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

properties.name: selectedDomain
properties.description:
New chart extents selected by the user

Serves as a trigger for the scale component to redefine the chart extents

properties.name: xAxisType
properties.description:
Sets the type of data for the x values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `time`: for time domains.
- `timeLocal`: for local time domains.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

properties.name: yAxisType
properties.description:
Sets the type of data for the y values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

properties.name: chartExtents
properties.description:
Developer set chart extents for the chart. The chart will draw to whatever values are specified in the chartExtents.
```
 {
     "x": [0,100],
     "y": [5,50],
 }
```

To force the chart to calculate based on data, use "dynamic".
```
 {
     "x": [0,"dynamic"],
     "y": [-10,"dynaimc"],
 }
```

For an ordinal dataset, chart extents can be set like this:
```
 {
     "x": ['low','medium','high'],
     "y": [5,50],
 }
```

properties.name: dataExtents
domainChanged
properties.description:
Boolean switching when the domain(s) has(have) changed

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw

properties.name: preventWebWorkerSynchronization
properties.description:
Prevents the chart from synchronizing its data with a webworker.
This can be turned on to minimize the memory footprint of the
chart
WARNING: turning the synchronization off will:
- prevent the chart from being able to use crosshair feature
- slow down data search for tooltip/register
- slow down calculating extents for the chart if it needs to

We advise against turning it off but it might be beneficial in
specific scenarios (high number of small charts with minimum
interaction for example)

properties.name: _extents
properties.description: Holder for chart extents from the seriesConfig object

properties.name: _chartDataHasChanged
properties.description: Boolean to detect if the chart data has changed

properties.name: _calculatingDomain
properties.description: Boolean to indicate if we are currently calculating the domain

properties.name: _defaultScaleValue
properties.description:
default extents to use if none are specified

0 for y axis for best practice

properties.name: disableDynamicUpdate
properties.description: Defines if the viewable chart extents should update when chartData is updated

properties.name: chartId
properties.description: Internal unique ID

methods.name: _processYValues
methods.description:
This functions process Y axis and applies the result to some variable.
If in single Y it just run the function and assign the result to `result`, if multi Y
it runs the function for each axis and stores the result against the axis key
on `result`

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-scale
      x-axis-type="time"
      y-axis-type="linear"
      complete-series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
      data-extents="[[dataExtents]]"
      width="[[width]]"
      height="[[height]]"
      margin="[[margin]]"
      chart-data="{{chartData}}"
      x="{{x}}"
      y="{{y}}"
      domain-changed="{{domainChanged}}"
      selected-domain="[[selectedDomain]]">
    </px-vis-scale>
    <px-vis-svg
      width="[[width]]"
      height="[[height]]"
      margin="[[margin]]"
      svg="{{svg}}">
    </px-vis-svg>
    <px-vis-scatter
      svg="[[svg]]"
      series-id="mySeries"
      complete-series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
      chart-data="[[chartData]]"
      x="[[x]]"
      y="[[y]]"
      domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]">
    </px-vis-scatter>

properties.name: svg
properties.description:
svg is a holder for the d3 instantiated svg container to draw to.
Must be set in ready and passed to all components so they know whom to draw to.

properties.name: _uniqueIdsUsed
properties.description:
Array of unique IDs generated for this comp. cleaned from global
store on detached

properties.name: pxSvgElem
properties.description: The SVG element inside the chart - not a D3 selected element.

properties.name: x
properties.description:
x is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

properties.name: y
properties.description:
y is a holder for the d3 instantiated scale object
Must be set in the svg component and passed to all components so they know the drawing scale.
This can be set declaratively

See: https://github.com/d3/d3/blob/master/API.md#scales-d3-scale

properties.name: chartData
properties.description:
container for the data object that drives the chart / component
Generally loaded with an iron-ajax tag (but doesnt have to be)
This can be set declaratively

properties.name: mutedSeries
properties.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

properties.name: clipPath
properties.description: Holder for a clipping path ID

properties.name: seriesClipPath
properties.description: A more restricting clip path used to limit where the series are being drawn

properties.name: interpolationFunction
properties.description:
A d3 function used to interpolate the series lines.

Can also be a string referencing simple, built in d3 functions:
- `"curveBasis"`
- `"curveBasisClosed"`
- `"curveBasisOpen"`
- `"curveLinear"`
- `"curveLinearClosed"`
- `"curveMonotoneX"`
- `"curveMonotoneY"`
- `"curveNatural"`
- `"curveStep"`
- `"curveStepAfter"`
- `"curveStepBefore"`

See: https://github.com/d3/d3-shape/blob/master/README.md#curves

properties.name: lineRadiusLimit
properties.description:
sets a minimum value for the line amplitude. Points less than the lineRadiusLimit will be set to the limit

Essentially, it moves a point that is past the center into the visible axis area on the opposite side to terminating inside the clip path area, thereby also changing the angle of those connecting lines

Note: radius on a radialLine is equivelent to y on a cartesean line.

properties.name: line
properties.description: A holder object for the line generator

properties.name: domainChanged
properties.description:
Boolean switching when the domain(s) has(have) changed

Serves as a trigger for many elements to redraw

properties.name: counterClockwise
properties.description: whether the polar data should be interpreted clockwise or counter-clockwise

properties.name: useDegrees
properties.description: Whether the angle data should be processed as degrees, as opposed to be processed as radians

properties.name: seriesId
properties.description: A unique ID for each line series

properties.name: _dynamicProperties
properties.description: A list of the dynamic properties

properties.name: serieToRedrawOnTop
properties.description:
Array containing a set of series to redraw on top of everything (in the order
they are found in this array)

properties.name: _isAttached
properties.description: Boolean tracking if we are attached

properties.name: markerMapping
properties.description:
Maps dev input marker string to d3 symbols.

To add additional, custom icons, provide a draw function wrapped in an object and draw your shape using canvas drawing methods. See 'bar' or 'x' as examples

properties.name: markerSymbol
properties.description:
The symbol used for the marker. Supported symbols:
- 'circle'
- 'cross'
- 'diamond'
- 'square'
- 'triangle-up'
- 'star'
- 'wye'
more info at https://github.com/d3/d3-shape/blob/master/README.md#symbols
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

Some additional "custom" types are also available:
- 'bar'
- 'thin-bar'
- 'thick-bar'
- 'x'

properties.name: markerScale
properties.description:
Scales the size of the scatter marker
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

properties.name: markerSize
properties.description:
the size of the markers
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

properties.name: markerFillOpacity
properties.description:
The opacity of the fill (inside) of the marker
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

properties.name: markerStrokeOpacity
properties.description:
The opacity of the stroke (outside) of the marker
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

properties.name: mutedOpacity
properties.description:
the opacity value of the fill to be used when muting a serie (stroke is not drawn on mute)
This property will be read from the completeSeriesConfig

properties.name: seriesNumber
properties.description: The index of the series, used for calculating its color.

properties.name: scatterGroup
properties.description: A holder object for the series group.

properties.name: scatterDots
properties.description: A holder object for the series objects.

properties.name: scatterBuilder
properties.description: A holder object for the series builder.

properties.name: radial
properties.description: Whether the scatter plot is using radial coordinates (x=phase, y=amplitude).

properties.name: timeData
properties.description: Name of the variable holding the time stamp in the data. Used for non-timeseries charts.

properties.name: drawDebounceTime
properties.description: Debounce time to use for drawing.

methods.name: generateRandomID
methods.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

methods.name: cloneSVGElem
methods.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

methods.name: _drawSVGOnCanvas
methods.description: Draws the current svg into a canvas

methods.name: _drawCanvg
methods.description:
Uses canvg third party to "translate" svg to javascript instructions
for the canvas, and draw on the canvas

methods.name: _nativeDrawSvgOnCanvas
methods.description: Tries to draw the SVG to canvas and if that doesnt work, falls back on a failure callback

methods.name: _getSVGOuterHtml
methods.description: fix for IE to get outer HTML

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-scale
      x-axis-type="time"
      y-axis-type="linear"
      complete-series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
      data-extents="[[dataExtents]]"
      width="[[width]]"
      height="[[height]]"
      margin="[[margin]]"
      chart-data="{{chartData}}"
      x="{{x}}"
      y="{{y}}"
      domain-changed="{{domainChanged}}"
      selected-domain="[[selectedDomain]]">
    </px-vis-scale>
    <px-vis-svg
      width="[[width]]"
      height="[[height]]"
      margin="[[margin]]"
      svg="{{svg}}">
    </px-vis-svg>
    <px-vis-striping
      svg="[[svg]]"
      series-id="mySeries"
      complete-series-config="[[seriesConfig]]"
      chart-data="[[chartData]]"
      width="[[width]]"
      height="[[height]]"
      margin="[[margin]]"
      x="[[x]]"
      y="[[y]]"
      domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]">
    </px-vis-striping>

elements.description:
### Usage

You must have a link import for px-vis-behavior-common, e.g.

    <link rel="import" href="../px-vis/px-vis-behavior-common.html" />

and include the PxVisBehavior.thresholds behavior in the behaviors array inside your Polymer object configuration.

The following attributes are required:

    <px-vis-threshold
        svg="[[svg]]"
        width="[[width]]"
        margin"[[margin]]"
        domain-changed="[[domainChanged]]"
        y="[[y]]"
        show-threshold-box="true"
        complete-series-config="[[CompleteSeriesConfig]]"
        threshold-data="[[thresholdData]]">
    </px-vis-threshold>

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
  `--px-vis-threshold-color` | The default color for a threshold

methods.name: generateRandomID
methods.description:
Generates a random id string.

Takes a string prefix, then adds 10 random chars

methods.name: cloneSVGElem
methods.description:
Clones a SVG elem and sets a component property with the d3 instance of that clone.

The intent of this is to clone the high level 'g' elem we draw to and attach it.
The draw order matters  in SVG and we want the some stuff to appear on top of everything else
Since we cannot easily ensure it draw order with components, we can stick top level items in a different 'g' that we know is drawn after the main 'g'

properties.name: horizontalAlignment
properties.description: Horizontal alignment of the toolbar. Should be 'left' or 'right'.

properties.name: subToolbarAlignment
properties.description:
Alignment of the sub toolbar. Accepted values:
- horizontal
- vertical
- above (when in a chart, the sub toolbar will be displayed
above the chart rather than on top of it)

properties.name: config
properties.description:
Configuration object for the toolbar. This object drives what buttons are available on
the toolbar and what they do. Three actions can be used out of the box by passing them
as keys in this config: 'zoom', 'pan' and 'tooltip'.
Any other kind of actions and buttons can be defined through this object. See above for example.

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-dynamic-menu
      dynamic-menu-config="[[dynamicMenuConfig]]">
    </px-vis-dynamic-menu>

properties.name: animationConfig
properties.description:
Animation config for the fadein/fadeout animations. Configure the "timing"
object of both animations if needed (delay, duration, ease).

properties.name: entryAnimation
properties.description:
Convenience property for setting an 'entry' animation. Do not set `animationConfig.entry`
manually if using this. The animated node is set to `this` if using this property.

properties.name: exitAnimation
properties.description:
Convenience property for setting an 'exit' animation. Do not set `animationConfig.exit`
manually if using this. The animated node is set to `this` if using this property.

properties.name: dynamicMenuConfig
_shown
properties.description: Whether the menu is currently shown.

properties.name: _opened
properties.description: Whether the menu is currently opened.

properties.name: displayClass
properties.description: Class to use when showing the element.

properties.name: additionalDetail
properties.description: Data to be passed back out when running an item's action or firing the associated event.

methods.name: getAnimationConfig
methods.description:
An element implementing `Polymer.NeonAnimationRunnerBehavior` calls this method to configure
an animation with an optional type. Elements implementing `Polymer.NeonAnimatableBehavior`
should define the property `animationConfig`, which is either a configuration object
or a map of animation type to array of configuration objects.

methods.name: playAnimation
methods.description: Plays an animation with an optional `type`.

methods.name: cancelAnimation
methods.description: Cancels the currently running animations.

methods.name: fadeIn
methods.description: Call this to fade in the menu icon. Doesn't apply if no menu config is defined.

methods.name: fadeOut
methods.description: Call this to fade out the menu icon. Doesn't apply if no menu config is defined.

attributes.name: animation-config
attributes.description:
Animation config for the fadein/fadeout animations. Configure the "timing"
object of both animations if needed (delay, duration, ease).

attributes.name: entry-animation
attributes.description:
Convenience property for setting an 'entry' animation. Do not set `animationConfig.entry`
manually if using this. The animated node is set to `this` if using this property.

attributes.name: exit-animation
attributes.description:
Convenience property for setting an 'exit' animation. Do not set `animationConfig.exit`
manually if using this. The animated node is set to `this` if using this property.

elements.description:
### Usage

    <px-vis-register-item
        item="[[item]]"
        complete-series-config="[[completeSeriesConfig]]"
        type="[[type]]"
        x-axis-type="[[xAxisType]]"
        y-axis-type="[[yAxisType]]">
    </px-vis-register-item>

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
  `--px-register-series-marker-width` | The width (thickness) of the series marker
  `--px-vis-register-series-name` | The color of the data series name
  `--px-vis-register-data-value` | The color of the data series value
  `--px-vis-register-box` | The color of the box around the register when a scrollbar is present
  |
  |
  |
  `--px-tooltip-background-color` | The color of the tooltip
  `--px-tooltip-text-color` | The color of the tooltip text
  `--px-tooltip-light-background-color` | The color of the light version tooltip
  `--px-tooltip-light-text-color` | The color of the light version tooltip text
  `--px-tooltip-light-border-color`| The color of the light version tooltip border

properties.name: mutedSeries
properties.description:
A list of user selected muted series. Tied declaratively to series components

The series name is the key and the value is a boolean for whether it is muted or not:

```
{
    'seriesId1':true,
    'seriesId2':false,
 }
```

In this example, seriesId1 is muted. seriesId2 was muted, but has been turned back on.

properties.name: xAxisType
properties.description:
Sets the type of data for the x values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `time`: for time domains.
- `timeLocal`: for local time domains.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts

properties.name: yAxisType
properties.description:
Sets the type of data for the y values

Valid entries are:
- `ordinal`: for discrete input domains, such as names or categories.
- `linear`: for continuous input domains, such as numbers.
- `pie`: for pie/donut charts
